RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 17500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility)(Races Whe re Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LEG UP took an immediate lead and rated the pace inside, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and dug in under steady encouragement to hold off the challenge of THEWITCHISGONE, who settled off the pace in the two and three paths, bid off the rail approaching the quarter pole, raced at a close disadvantage two deep on the far turn and remained a factor to mid-stretch before relenting. WINDSOR'S TRACKER saved ground off the pace, picked up the chase leaving the half mile pole and improved at the rail on the far turn, but flattened stride leaving the turn. SEAN THE HAMMER stalked the earlier pace from the three path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn but showed little in the lane. NIGHT TRAIN WAYNE stalked off the rail on the first turn, challenged nearing the three eighths pole but faded past the five sixteenths. THUNDERINREADYRICK raced in the four path the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole, though, weakened in the four path on the far turn. SPARKLING SHIRE dropped well back from contention, showed no response leaving the first turn and was eased.

ENTRY.NAME: Thewitchisgone
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 2& 3p,bid nearing 1/4,close 2d turn,relented later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Windsor's Tracker
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased past 1/2,improved rail turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Thunderinreadyrick
ENTRY.OWNER: Bass Tamera L Perry William M and Perry Susan D

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: POWERED BY LOVE took the lead at the half mile pole and set a pressured pace through the backstretch, widened at the rail on the turn and was kept alert to deep stretch. SOUL CATCHER hesitated leaving the gate and raced well back from early contention, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, entered the turn off the rail but was eased outward toward the top of the stretch, left the turn in the five path and got up for second later yards. LOVE IS WICKED gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. GREATEST NOTION gave chase inside, raced boxed at the heels Powered By Love past the five sixteenths pole but quickly resumed stride and rounded the turn at the rail, though, flattened nearing mid-stretch. DIRECT PROOF gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail and showed little in the lane. CANDY FOR JUBA gave chase and raced off the rail on the turn, was eased outward leaving the turn and showed little further. DESTIN'S RAINBOW pressed the early pace but dropped back toward the five sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the turn and weakened in the lane. BRADLEY DO RIGHT gave chase outside then weakened in the six path on the turn. YOUTHFUL ENERGY bobbled leaving the gate and dropped well back. Christopher'sheart ran loose in the post parade and was a late scratch.

ENTRY.NAME: Powered by Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,cleared near 5/16,widened turn,kept alert lane

ENTRY.NAME: Soul Catcher
ENTRY.COMMENT: hesitated break,chased 3/8,off rail into turn,5p 1/8,up 2nd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 78. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 21 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 21 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,0 00 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PINK DINGHY contested the early pace and took the nod leaving the seven sixteenths pole, was urged away at the rail on the turn then kept sharp in the stretch. TEACHINTHERELEASE gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn then dueled through the stretch for second. JUBA BOUND gave chase inside, raced blocked at the heels of Teachintherelease toward the head of the lane, squeezed through at the rail entering the stretch and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. EL LUCERITO pressured the pace through the backstretch, drifted to the five path on the turn then flattened toward mid-stretch. BERTRAM FLIGHT veered out and hit the gate at the break then gave chase, closed to the heels of rivals approaching the eighth pole, raced hemmed in through the upper stretch but finished well when clear. STROLLINGINTHEWIND came away awkwardly then gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. LORD OF CORK gave chase, was forced outward through the turn, left the turn about the six path and showed little more. COLT ROCK gave chase through the backstretch, was forced out into the turn, altered course to the three path through the turn but proved empty on the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Bertram Flight
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out,hit gate break,closed to heels near 1/8,finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Pink Dinghy
ENTRY.COMMENT: nod past 7/16,urged away rail turn,kept sharp lane

ENTRY.NAME: El Lucerito
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell Marshall T and Bentley Donald L

ENTRY.NAME: Colt Rock
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,forced out into turn,3p turn,empty lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 44. Maiden Claiming Purse 14400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHARITABLE WINDSOR took the lead at the thirteen sixteenths pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure past the three eighths, raced at the rail on the far turn and was kept alert in the lane. COLONIAL ROAD tapered in and stalked two deep. picked up the chase past the half mile pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and settled for second. CURB THAT TIGER settled off the rail on the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and steadily improved from that point, rounded the turn in the three path but had little left in the lane. I SEE NOTHING saved ground, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and showed little further. JUBAY veered out leaving the gate and rounded the opening turn about the four path, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and weakened in the lane. A BIT OF HARLOW saved ground, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. TO THE TOP raced off the pace in the two and three paths and showed little response through the backstretch. JUBA'S MOCHA veered out leaving the gate and was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: I See Nothing
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Charitable Windsor
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,kept alert lane

ENTRY.NAME: Curb That Tiger
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid 7/16,steadily improved,3p far turn,little left lane

ENTRY.NAME: Jubay
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out break,4p 1st turn,chased 3/8,off rail turn,weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Allowance Purse 30500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 21 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 21 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAKIN' GOLD set the early pace inside, was met at the seven sixteenths pole and rated close from that point, steadied in tight at the rail past the five sixteenths, raced boxed in through the far turn but eased out leaving the turn, dug in and took the nod in the final yards. JAZZ WITH DENIS stalked the early pace then took the lead leaving the seven sixteenths pole, came under pressure past the three eighths, raced near the rail on the far turn, dug in from the head of the lane but was caught in the final yards. DON'TCALLTOOEARLY saved ground off the pace, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole and improved at the rail on the far turn, lost momentum off the heels of Makin' Gold entering the stretch, angled inside that one in the upper stretch but was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. KAYLEE'S SPITFIRE rounded the opening turn about the four path then stalked into the backstretch, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn then weakened. I'M THE MONEY MAN settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase into the backstretch and rounded the far turn near the rail, eased outward through the upper stretch and finished evenly to pass rivals. ALDRINALINE saved ground on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path and showed little in the lane. LIEUTENANT BROWN entered the first turn in the five path, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and weakened. TREASURER rated close to the early pace inside, gave chase passing the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and weakened. O'RIGSBY saved early ground then rounded the far turn in the three and four paths.

ENTRY.NAME: Treasurer
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 5/16,off rail far turn,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Makin' Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,met 7/16,boxed turn,dug in lane,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Aldrinaline
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,5p far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: I'm the Money Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail early,chased past 1/2,rail far turn,eased out,even fnish

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TAP SECRET took the lead nearing the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and held well under steady stretch handling. CATCHING STARS had a brief early lead then stalked from the three quarter pole, gave chase approaching the three eighths, rounded the far turn near the rail and settled for second best. YO VINNIE stalked from the three path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path but flattened inside the eighth pole. TEMPESTIVO settled off the rail on the first turn, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and showed little further. GLOBALIZATION raced well back off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase past the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and ran evenly in the stretch. DIVINAS CONNECTION settled off the rail on the first turn then eased out into the backstretch and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path and weakened in the lane. REMASTERED entered the first turn about the five path and showed little response through the backstretch. FLOOR IT raced in the three path the opening turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and weakened in the stretch. NEVER FOR SPEIGHT saved ground on the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole and weakened in the four path of the far turn. FAIRPIT rated close two deep on the opening turn then faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Globalization
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back,chased 3/8,improved rail far turn,even finish

ENTRY.NAME: Tap Secret
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 7/16,rail far turn,held well driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 95. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 32700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. No n-winners Of A Race Since June 21 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 21 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MUAD'DIB moved in and saved ground on the first turn then eased out into the backstretch, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole, circled horses in the five path on the far turn and took the lead passing the eighth pole, dueled clear toward mid-stretch and held on under steady handling. JUNGLE BEAST saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase into the backstretch and raced three wide in the far turn, angled to the six path toward the head of the lane, dueled through the stretch for second and finished well at the outside flank of the winner. FANCY CONCHO was jostled hard and pinched back leaving the gate then saved ground racing well back, started a bid past the three eighths pole, steadily progressed off the rail on the far turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. HERO'S MAN ducked in and made contact with Fancy Concho leaving the gate, rounded the first turn about the four path and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and flattened later yards. OX DOC veered outward and into Bubba Grump leaving the gate then took a quick lead and rated the pace, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, contested the edge at the rail on the far turn, was met passing the eighth pole and weakened. ROCKET APPEAL stalked two deep then challenged toward the three eighths pole, raced close two deep on the far turn but weakened in the lane. BUBBA GRUMP was bumped outward and into Fancy Concho then rated close inside, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail then weakened. BRISTOL CHANNEL stalked the early pace three wide, gave chase from the three eighths pole but weakened past the five sixteenths.

ENTRY.NAME: Ox Doc
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out,bumped break,pace inside,edge rail turn,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Hero's Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked in,bumped,4p 1st turn,chased 7/16,4p far turn,flatten late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 15200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JANUARY 21, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since January 21 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500 , allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).

CLAIM.OWNER: Pesaturo Gus and Joy Kevin J

RACE.FOOTNOTES: GILLIGAN stalked the early pace three wide, took the nod leaving the seven sixteenths pole and dueled with the edge from that point, raced clear approaching the quarter pole, dug in under steady encouragement leaving the turn but angled out and made contact with We B Shackin in late stretch and just lasted. HAPPY CHARLIE saved ground on the first turn, bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole, angled to the seven path on the far turn and dug in under steady handling from the head of the lane, was bumped out in late stretch and just missed the nod. ROYAL CRUSADER saved ground on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, dug in through the stretch and just got up for third. WE B SHACKIN saved ground, bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced close two deep while between horses approaching the head of the lane, eased out into the lane and dug in from that point but was bumped outward and into Happy Charlie in late stretch then pinched back approaching the wire. TOUGH TO TAME rounded the first turn in the three path then eased out into the backstretch, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path, swung to the outside into the lane and finished well to pass rivals widest. REY O REYES had the early lead inside, was met at the nine sixteenths pole and gave chase into the backstretch, but dropped back at the rail nearing the quarter pole and weakened leaving the far turn. FIVE STAR PHIL rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole but faded in the four path of the far turn. TRINGALE stalked the early pace two deep while between horses, took the nod at the nine sixteenths pole, was met leaving the seven sixteenths and gave chase from that point but weakened in the three path of the far turn. PROTA settled close off the rail the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole then weakened off the rail on the far turn. A Stewards inquiry and subsequent claims of foul lodged against the rider of Gilligan for interference in late stretch, lodged by the riders of We B Shackin and Happy Charlie, resulted in the disqualification of Gilligan to fourth place.

ENTRY.NAME: Prota
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Rey O Reyes
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Charlie
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 7/16,angled 7p turn,dug in lane,just missed nod
